page.title: 02East Ravendale Hall
page.content: East Ravendale Hall has been opened as an old peoples' home since February 1984. The people who own the hall are called the Mortimers and 4 members of the family live at the hall now. There are 13 places for old people but they hope for 17. Â£110 is the fee set by the government. 14 people work at the hall and special diets are provided for the inmates. The hall was previously owned by the Parkinsons and before them the seventh Baronet Thorold. The hall was built as a hall in 1720. Before then it was a small farm house. There are a few legends about the hall, the most popular is called the Black Lady. The old woman is said to have set 3 rooms on fire in the hall. Members of the Parkinson family have seen this ghost.
